original_solution_mapping.L1: He needs 9 scoops of flour because 3 / (1/3) = <<3/(1/3)=9>>9
original_solution_mapping.L2: He needs 6 scoops of sugar because 2 / (1/3) = <<2/(1/3)=6>>6

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7230.
    Returns: the total number of scoops Mitch needs.
    """
    # L1
    flour_cups = 3 # 3 cups of flour
    scoop_size = Fraction(1, 3) # a 1/3 cup scoop
    flour_scoops = flour_cups / scoop_size

    # L2
    sugar_cups = 2 # two cups of sugar
    sugar_scoops = sugar_cups / scoop_size

    # L3
    total_scoops = flour_scoops + sugar_scoops

    # FA
    answer = total_scoops
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He needs {flour_scoops} scoops of flour because {flour_cups} / ({scoop_size}) = <<{flour_cups}/({scoop_size})={flour_scoops}>>{flour_scoops}
He needs {sugar_scoops} scoops of sugar because {sugar_cups} / ({scoop_size}) = <<{sugar_cups}/({scoop_size})={sugar_scoops}>>{sugar_scoops}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He needs 1 scoops of flour because 3 / (1/3) = <<3/(1/3)=1>>1
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He needs 6 scoops of sugar because 2 / (1/3) = <<2/(1/3)=6>>6

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '/' but used '*' instead.
